result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal L. Hearton

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Motion to withdraw filed by Attorney Gianitsos on 10/12/22 is scheduled to be heard on 11/14/22 at 3:00 pm. Date/time confirmed with parties by email. Notice sent.
Proposed Order To Withdraw as Atty of Record
To Withdraw as Atty of Record

10:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Crystal L. Hearton in court.  Attorney Alexia S Gianitsos in court for Crystal L. Hearton. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM647/22CM798/22CM825/22CM1381. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Gianitsos advises the Court that she just received electronic discovery on October 4th and is requesting a 60 day adjournment so she may review the discovery. The State does not object. Bond motion filed by Attorney Gianitsos in Cases 22CM647 and 22CM798. Arguments heard. For reasons set forth on the record the bond motion is denied.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE appears late. DE states she has not been able to apply at SPD due to medical issues. Court orderes DE to go and apply at SPD today from court. Court quashes authorization of warrant and reinstates bond. STC set to 10/07/22 at 10:30.

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk. M.Burke.  State in victim rights compliance. Due to the non appearance by the DE court forfeits bond and issues a $750 bench warrant.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Herman H. Jr.

01:09 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered by the Court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:10 am. $500  Cash Bond continued posted w/ additional conditions (see bond entry). DE was taken into custody on new charges. mi
